intro: Moraea ciliata, commonly known as the fringed moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinctive fringed or hairy appearance along the edges. Moraea ciliata is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and is often used in rockeries and borders.
